page.title: 02Age Concern Centre
page.content: The Hassocks Age Concern Centre was opened in 1980. Its facilities include a chiropodist, a meals on wheels service, free transport to medical appointments and hairdressing. All but two of the workers are {voluntary.}The meals that are served cost 75p. The centre cost Â£83,000 to build, and each year the catering bill is about Â£8,000. The gas and electricity bills come to approximately Â£5,500. The{council}pays a grant towards this, which covers just under half. The rest is raised by fund raising events. In 1983 a new extension to the centre was opened. The centre opens on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday until 2.30pm. On Tuesday and Friday it is open for coffee only. Each day the centre opens at 10.00 am.
